thread.title: Avon court magistrate resigns after weekend drunk driving arrest, mayor says
thread.title_full: Avon court magistrate resigns after weekend drunk driving arrest, mayor says | cleveland.com

author: Michael Sangiacomo, The Plain Dealer
title: Avon court magistrate resigns after weekend drunk driving arrest, mayor says
text:
Michael Sangiacomo AVON, Ohio -- Avon City Magistrate Tom Stringer resigned over the weekend after being charged with drunk driving on Interstate 90 near the Westlake border, Avon mayor said.
Mayor Bryan Jensen said that Stringer had "done an admirable job in his position as magistrate" but understood his decision to resign.
Jensen said Stringer was stopped Friday evening by the Ohio State Patrol for speeding. According to Jensen, Stringer did not submit to a breathalyzer test.
Stringer's case will be decided in Avon Lake Municipal Court. He could not be reached for comment.
Jensen said String had been magistrate of the mayor's court, which handles misdemeanors and traffic offenses for the city, for about a year.
The mayor said it was "disappointing that I have to report on this type of incident with all the positive things happening in Avon."
City Attorney Kreig Brusnahan, magistrate for Sheffield Village, will handle the Avon cases in the city's Mayor's Court one day a week on Wednesdays until further notice.
